questions.text: AWS allows users to manage their resources using a web based user interface. What is the name of this interface?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. AWS Management Console. This is the web-based interface for managing AWS resources.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of horizontal scaling in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: A. Replacing an existing EC2 instance with a larger, more powerful one.
B. Increasing the compute capacity of a single EC2 instance to address the growing demands of an application.
C. Adding more RAM capacity to an EC2 instance.
D. Adding more EC2 instances of the same size to handle an increase in traffic.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Horizontal scaling involves adding more instances of the same size to distribute load, while vertical scaling (A/B/C) involves upgrading existing instances.

questions.text: You have noticed that several critical Amazon EC2 instances have been terminated. Which of the following AWS services would help you determine who took this action?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. AWS CloudTrail logs API calls and user actions, providing an audit trail of who terminated instances.

questions.text: Which of the below options are related to the reliability of AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Applying the principle of least privilege to all AWS resources.
B. Automatically provisioning new resources to meet demand.
C. All AWS services are considered Global Services, and this design helps customers serve their international users.
D. Providing compensation to customers if issues occur.
E. Ability to recover quickly from failures.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and E. Reliability in AWS includes automatic scaling (B) to maintain availability and rapid recovery (E) from failures.

questions.text: Which statement is true regarding the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?

options.text: A. Responsibilities vary depending on the services used.
B. Security of the IaaS services is the responsibility of AWS.
C. Patching the guest OS is always the responsibility of AWS.
D. Security of the managed services is the responsibility of the customer.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. The Shared Responsibility Model divides tasks between AWS and the customer, with AWS managing security 'of' the cloud (infrastructure) and customers managing security 'in' the cloud (data, OS, etc.).

questions.text: You have set up consolidated billing for several AWS accounts. One of the accounts has purchased a number of reserved instances for 3 years. Which of the following is true regarding this scenario?

options.text: A. The Reserved Instance discounts can only be shared with the master account.
B. All accounts can receive the hourly cost benefit of the Reserved Instances.
C. The purchased instances will have better performance than On-demand instances.
D. There are no cost benefits from using consolidated billing; It is for informational purposes only.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Consolidated billing allows Reserved Instance discounts to be shared across all linked accounts, reducing hourly costs.

questions.text: A company has developed an eCommerce web application in AWS. What should they do to ensure that the application has the highest level of availability?

options.text: A. Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and Edge locations.
B. Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and subnets.
C. Deploy the application across multiple Regions and Availability Zones.
D. Deploy the application across multiple VPC’s and subnets.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Multi-Region deployment provides the highest availability by protecting against Region-wide failures, while multiple AZs protect against data center failures.

questions.text: What does AWS Snowball provide? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Built-in computing capabilities that allow customers to process data locally.
B. A catalog of third-party software solutions that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses.
C. A hybrid cloud storage between on-premises environments and the AWS Cloud.
D. An Exabyte-scale data transfer service that allows you to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS.
E. Secure transfer of large amounts of data into and out of the AWS.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and E. AWS Snowball offers edge computing (A) for local data processing and secure data transfer (E) for large datasets.

questions.text: A company has an AWS Enterprise Support plan. They want quick and efficient guidance with their billing and account inquiries. Which of the following should the company use?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. The AWS Support Concierge is a dedicated team for Enterprise Support customers to assist with billing and account issues.

questions.text: A Japanese company hosts their applications on Amazon EC2 instances in the Tokyo Region. The company has opened new branches in the United States, and the US users are complaining of high latency. What can the company do to reduce latency for the users in the US while minimizing costs?

options.text: A. Applying the Amazon Connect latency-based routing policy.
B. Registering a new US domain name to serve the users in the US.
C. Building a new data center in the US and implementing a hybrid model.
D. Deploying new Amazon EC2 instances in a Region located in the US.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Deploying resources in a Region closer to end users (e.g., US Region for US users) reduces latency. This is more cost-effective than building a data center (C).

questions.text: An organization has a large number of technical employees who operate their AWS Cloud infrastructure. What does AWS provide to help organize them into teams and then assign the appropriate permissions for each team?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. IAM user groups allow administrators to assign permissions to multiple users at once, simplifying team management.

questions.text: A company has decided to migrate its Oracle database to AWS. Which AWS service can help achieve this without negatively impacting the functionality of the source database?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) enables seamless migration of databases to AWS with minimal downtime or impact on the source database.

questions.text: Adjusting compute capacity dynamically to reduce cost is an implementation of which AWS cloud best practice?

options.text: A. Build security in every layer.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Elasticity allows resources to scale up/down automatically based on demand, optimizing costs.

questions.text: What are the benefits of having infrastructure hosted in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: B. There is no need to worry about security.
C. Gaining complete control over the physical infrastructure.
D. Operating applications on behalf of customers.
E. All of the physical security and most of the data/network security are taken care of for you.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and E. AWS provides agility (A) through rapid provisioning and manages physical/network security (E), though customers must still secure their data and applications.

questions.text: What is the advantage of the AWS-recommended practice of "decoupling" applications?

options.text: A. Allows treating an application as a single, cohesive unit.
B. Reduces inter-dependencies so that failures do not impact other components of the application.
C. Allows updates of any monolithic application quickly and easily.
D. Allows tracking of any API call made to any AWS service.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Decoupling components (e.g., using SQS or Lambda) isolates failures and improves fault tolerance.

questions.text: Which of the following helps a customer view the Amazon EC2 billing activity for the past month?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. AWS Cost & Usage Reports provide detailed billing data, including EC2 usage history.

questions.text: What do you gain from setting up consolidated billing for five different AWS accounts under another master account?

options.text: A. AWS services’ costs will be reduced to half the original price.
B. The consolidated billing feature is just for organizational purpose.
C. Each AWS account gets volume discounts.
D. Each AWS account gets five times the free-tier services capacity.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Consolidated billing combines usage across accounts, potentially qualifying for volume discounts.

questions.text: What should you do in order to keep the data on EBS volumes safe? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Regularly update firmware on EBS devices.
C. Ensure that EBS data is encrypted at rest.
D. Store a backup daily in an external drive.
E. Prevent any unauthorized access to AWS data centers.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and C. EBS snapshots (B) provide backups, and encryption (C) protects data at rest. AWS manages physical security (E).

questions.text: One of the most important AWS best-practices to follow is the cloud architecture principle of elasticity. How does this principle improve your architecture’s design?

options.text: A. By automatically scaling your on-premises resources based on changes in demand.
B. By automatically scaling your AWS resources using an Elastic Load Balancer.
C. By reducing interdependencies between application components wherever possible.
D. By automatically provisioning the required AWS resources based on changes in demand.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Elasticity ensures resources scale automatically to match demand, optimizing cost and performance.

questions.text: A startup company is operating on limited funds and is extremely concerned about cost overruns. Which of the below options can be used to notify the company when their monthly AWS bill exceeds $2000? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Setup a CloudWatch billing alarm that triggers an SNS notification when the threshold is exceeded.
B. Configure the Amazon Simple Email Service to send billing alerts to their email address on a daily basis.
C. Configure the AWS Budgets Service to alert the company when the threshold is exceeded.
D. Configure AWS CloudTrail to automatically delete all AWS resources when the threshold is exceeded.
E. Configure the Amazon Connect Service to alert the company when the threshold is exceeded.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and C. CloudWatch billing alarms (A) and AWS Budgets (C) can trigger alerts when costs exceed a threshold.

questions.text: What does Amazon CloudFront use to distribute content to global users with low latency?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. CloudFront uses Edge Locations (global CDN nodes) to cache and deliver content closer to users.

questions.text: What does the "Principle of Least Privilege" refer to?

options.text: A. You should grant your users only the permissions they need when they need them and nothing more.
B. All IAM users should have at least the necessary permissions to access the core AWS services.
C. All trusted IAM users should have access to any AWS service in the respective AWS account.
D. IAM users should not be granted any permissions; to keep your account safe.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. The Principle of Least Privilege minimizes security risks by restricting permissions to only what is necessary.

questions.text: Which of the following does NOT belong to the AWS Cloud Computing models?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. AWS does not classify its services under 'Networking as a Service' (NaaS). The main models are IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

questions.text: The identification process of an online financial services company requires that new users must complete an online interview with their security team. The completed recorded interviews are only required in the event of a legal issue or a regulatory compliance breach. What is the most cost-effective service to store the recorded videos?

options.text: C. Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest-cost storage for rarely accessed data (e.g., compliance archives).

questions.text: Which service provides DNS in the AWS cloud?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. Amazon Route 53 is AWS's scalable DNS and domain registration service.

questions.text: Hundreds of thousands of DDoS attacks are recorded every month worldwide. What service does AWS provide to help protect AWS Customers from these attacks? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and D. AWS Shield (A) protects against DDoS attacks, and AWS WAF (D) filters malicious web traffic.

questions.text: A company is deploying a new two-tier web application in AWS. Where should the most frequently accessed data be stored so that the application’s response time is optimal?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. ElastiCache (Redis/Memcached) is an in-memory cache for frequently accessed data, reducing latency.

questions.text: You want to run a questionnaire application for only one day (without interruption), which Amazon EC2 purchase option should you use?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. On-demand instances are ideal for short-term, uninterrupted workloads with no long-term commitment.

questions.text: You are working on a project that involves creating thumbnails of millions of images. Consistent uptime is not an issue, and continuous processing is not required. Which EC2 buying option would be the most cost-effective?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Spot Instances offer the lowest cost for fault-tolerant, interruptible workloads like batch processing.

questions.text: Which of the following can be described as a global content delivery network (CDN) service?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Amazon CloudFront is AWS's CDN service, caching content at Edge Locations for low-latency delivery.

questions.text: Which of the following services allows customers to manage their agreements with AWS?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. AWS Artifact provides access to AWS compliance documents and agreements.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of AWS-Managed Services, where AWS is responsible for the operational and maintenance burdens of running the service? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and C. DynamoDB (NoSQL) and EMR (big data) are fully managed. EC2 (E) and VPC (A) require customer management.

questions.text: Your company has a data store application that requires access to a NoSQL database. Which AWS database offering would meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL database service.

questions.text: As part of the Enterprise support plan, who is the primary point of contact for ongoing support needs?

options.text: A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Enterprise Support includes a dedicated TAM for personalized guidance.

questions.text: How can you view the distribution of AWS spending in one of your AWS accounts?

options.text: A. By using Amazon VPC console.
B. By contacting the AWS Support team.
C. By using AWS Cost Explorer.
D. By contacting the AWS Finance team.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. AWS Cost Explorer provides visualizations and reports for cost analysis.

questions.text: Which of the following must an IAM user provide to interact with AWS services using the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. AWS CLI requires access keys (access key ID and secret access key) for authentication.

questions.text: You have AWS Basic support, and you have discovered that some AWS resources are being used maliciously, and those resources could potentially compromise your data. What should you do?

options.text: A. Contact the AWS Customer Service team.
B. Contact the AWS Abuse team.
C. Contact the AWS Concierge team.
D. Contact the AWS Security team.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. The AWS Abuse team handles reports of malicious activity or compromised resources.

questions.text: Select TWO examples of the AWS shared controls.
questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and D. Shared controls (e.g., patching, configuration) are jointly managed by AWS and the customer.

questions.text: In order to implement best practices when dealing with a “Single Point of Failure,” you should attempt to build as much automation as possible in both detecting and reacting to failure. Which of the following AWS services would help? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and B. Elastic Load Balancing (A) distributes traffic, and Auto Scaling (B) replaces failed instances automatically.

questions.text: A company is planning to host an educational website on AWS. Their video courses will be streamed all around the world. Which of the following AWS services will help achieve high transfer speeds?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. CloudFront's CDN caches videos at Edge Locations for low-latency global delivery.

questions.text: A developer is planning to build a two-tier web application that has a MySQL database layer. Which of the following AWS database services would provide automated backups for the application?

options.text: A. A MySQL database installed on an EC2 instance.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. Amazon Aurora (MySQL-compatible) provides automated backups and point-in-time recovery.

questions.text: What is the AWS service that enables AWS architects to manage infrastructure as code?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: A. AWS CloudFormation allows infrastructure to be defined and provisioned using templates (infrastructure as code).

questions.text: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the responsibility of AWS?

options.text: D. Filtering traffic with Security Groups.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: B. AWS manages the security 'of' the cloud (e.g., physical infrastructure, networking hardware).

questions.text: What does the AWS Health Dashboard provide? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Detailed troubleshooting guidance to address AWS events impacting your resources.
B. Health checks for Auto Scaling instances.
D. A dashboard detailing vulnerabilities in your applications.
E. Personalized view of AWS service health.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: A and E. The AWS Health Dashboard provides personalized alerts (E) and remediation guidance (A) for AWS-related issues.

questions.text: You have deployed your application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Your customers complain that sometimes they can’t reach your application. Which AWS service allows you to monitor the performance of your EC2 instances to assist in troubleshooting these issues?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. CloudWatch monitors EC2 performance metrics (e.g., CPU, network) and can trigger alarms for outages.

questions.text: Your company is developing a critical web application in AWS, and the security of the application is a top priority. Which of the following AWS services will provide infrastructure security optimization recommendations?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Trusted Advisor provides real-time security best practice checks and recommendations.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a benefit of Amazon S3? (Choose TWO)

options.text: A. Amazon S3 provides unlimited storage for any type of data.
B. Amazon S3 can run any type of application or backend system.
C. Amazon S3 stores any number of objects, but with object size limits.
D. Amazon S3 can be scaled manually to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere.
E. Amazon S3 provides 99.999999999% (11 9’s) of data durability.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: B and D. S3 is storage-only (B: cannot run applications) and scales automatically (D: no manual scaling needed).

questions.text: In the AWS Shared responsibility Model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.text: B. Controlling physical access to compute resources.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: D and E. Customers manage identity/password policies (D) and security groups/NACLs (E). AWS handles physical security (B) and infrastructure patching (C).

questions.text: What does AWS provide to deploy popular technologies such as IBM MQ on AWS with the least amount of effort and time?

options.text: C. AWS Quick Start reference deployments.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: C. AWS Quick Starts are pre-built templates for deploying third-party technologies like IBM MQ rapidly.

questions.text: An organization has decided to purchase an Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) for three years in order to reduce costs. It is possible that the application workloads could change during the reservation period. What is the EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) type that will allow the company to exchange the purchased reserved instance for another reserved instance with higher computing power if they need to?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: D. Convertible RIs allow exchange for another RI with different attributes (e.g., instance type) while retaining the billing benefit.
